title: What Does â€œThat Damn Smirkâ€ Mean on TikTok?

steps.title: â€œThat damn smirkâ€ is a TikTok trend using the Face Puzzle filter.
steps.content: â€œThat damn smirkâ€ is a TikTok trend using the Face Puzzle filter. To participate, a user posts a photo or video of themselves smiling using the Face Puzzle filter, which moves their features to different places on their face. They usually move their eyes and mouth down to create a silly, nose-less look and caption their post with â€œthat damn smirk.â€ It doesn't really mean anything, it's just meant to crack everyone up! Users also tend to comment â€œthat damn smirkâ€ on any video or photo of someone who has a unique smirk or smug smile. In TikTok comments, users often pair the "proud" emoticon with â€œThat damn smirkâ€ to show that theyâ€™re joking. Users typically post their â€œthat damn smirkâ€ videos with the song â€œMapsâ€ by Yeah Yeah Yeahs. While the reasoning isnâ€™t clear, it may be related to the â€œWait, they donâ€™t love you like I love youâ€ TikTok trend. For the trend, users play â€œMapsâ€ by Yeah Yeah Yeahs, putting their hands in a â€œstopâ€ formation with the â€œWaitâ€ lyric before shaking their hips during the â€œthey donâ€™t love you like I love youâ€ lyric. The Face Puzzle filter is popular on Instagram, Snapchat , and TikTok. To use it, search â€œFace Puzzleâ€ in the filter section of any of the above apps. You can access the filter section by opening the camera on these apps.

steps.title: People caption silly looking videos of themselves with "that damn smirk."
steps.content: People caption silly looking videos of themselves with "that damn smirk." The silly trend doesn't really have any specific meaning. Users are just having fun and making folks laugh at how weird and funny they look with the Face Puzzle filter. For example, on October 4, 2024, TikTok user @5star_brandonnn posted a video where he used the Face Puzzle filter to get rid of his nose, captioning it with â€œâ˜ºï¸ #thatdamnsmirk.â€ If you wanted to use it online, itâ€™d go something like this: Your Friend: â€œDid you see that video Connor posted with the Face Puzzle filter? His smile looked crazy!â€ You: I know, right. That damn smirk ğŸ˜â€ TikTok user @varqsine even used the meme to describe their dogâ€™s goofy smile in a video posted on January 25, 2025. Since then, the videoâ€™s received 3.5 million likes! TikTok user @nimbwr fully embraced the meme on October 2, 2024, when they posted a video with their eyes and eyebrows on their forehead and their mouth was where their nose should be. It was captioned, â€œthat damn smirk.â€

steps.title: â€œThat damn smirkâ€ likely stems from the â€œthat damn smileâ€ meme.
steps.content: â€œThat damn smirkâ€ likely stems from the â€œthat damn smileâ€ meme. Although the specific origin of â€œthat damn smirkâ€ is unknown, itâ€™s widely believed to have come from the â€œthat damn smileâ€ meme which references the Netflix drama 13 Reasons Why, which was popular in the late 2010s. When â€œthat damn smirkâ€ came around isnâ€™t entirely clear, but itâ€™s been around since at least 2022. On June 6, 2022, TikTok user @stellasvt posted an edit of popular K-Pop singer, Dawon, with the caption â€œThat damn smirk ğŸ˜,â€ which was one of the earliest uses of the meme on TikTok. The â€œthat damn smileâ€ meme has stood the test of time. On January 18, 2024, the X (formerly Twitter) gaming account posted the four-panel meme in reference to one of their in-game charactersâ€™ smiles. X user @Pestily used the meme back on August 18, 2021 when he posted the images of 13 Reasons Why character Hannah Baker talking about Zach Dempseyâ€™s smile, except Dempseyâ€™s face was replaced with his own.

steps.title: The "proud" emoji on TikTok is often used in â€œthat damn smirkâ€ posts.
steps.content: The "proud" emoji on TikTok is often used in â€œthat damn smirkâ€ posts. On TikTok, users often comment the "proud" emoji in the comment section of â€œthat damn smirkâ€ meme videos. The emoji features a smirking, spikey-haired character with their eyes closed. If they arenâ€™t commenting the emoji on a video of the meme, theyâ€™re typically using the emoji to refer to the meme in videos of people with unique and interesting smirks. How to Get It: Head to the TikTok comments and type [proud], then click space. The emoji will automatically appear.

steps.title: â€œThat damn smileâ€ is a specific meme; â€œthat damn smirkâ€ is a meme phrase.
steps.content: â€œThat damn smileâ€ is a specific meme; â€œthat damn smirkâ€ is a meme phrase. The â€œthat damn smileâ€ meme is a four-panel meme that takes a 13 Reasons Why scene where the main character says â€œthat smileâ€¦ that damn smileâ€ and uses it in response to funny-looking smiles. [1] X Research source These two memes are extremely similar. But, the key difference is that â€œthat damn smileâ€ typically refers to a funny-looking smile in a four-panel meme format, while â€œthat damn smirkâ€ is often used as a caption or comment. Theyâ€™re both used to refer to interesting or funny-looking smiles and smirks, but â€œthat damn smileâ€ is in a more classic panel format. â€œThat damn smileâ€ likely uses the 4-panel format because of its age and popularity on Twitter (now X).

steps.title: Very Demure
steps.content: Very Demure The â€œ very demure â€ trend is a TikTok trend where users have a subtle, yet cute look. This trend encourages users to be reserved and modest while still serving stylish, cute looks. Looks that are often considered â€œvery cute, very demure.â€ [2] X Research source

steps.title: This Is Zesty
steps.content: This Is Zesty The â€œthis is zestyâ€ trend is a popular TikTok trend where daughters go up to their manly dads and ask them to taste something and say â€œthis is zesty â€ is a feminine accent. Many users find this trend humorous because the dads tend to look like they have super deep, gravely voices, so hearing their pitch that high cracks a laugh. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Brat Summer
steps.content: Brat Summer Brat Summer was a popular TikTok trend in the summer of 2024. It was inspired by Charli XCXâ€™s album brat , and was all about having fun, partying, putting yourself first, and looking good while doing it. Brat Summer was characterized by having an â€œIDGAFâ€ attitude and having fun for yourself and nobody else, echoing sentiments from the album. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Aura Farming
steps.content: Aura Farming Aura farming is a current TikTok trend that involves trying to look cool in a nonchalant, care-free way. Aura farming is usually done to gain aura , which are basically â€œcool points,â€ and TikTok users love to call out people who are aura farming. For example, Duke Dennis is often accused of aura farming, as he tends to keep a straight face and clean walk when going through crowds of fans, exuding tons of â€œauraâ€ as he does.
